## preceded() function

Creates a Parser that applies the given two parsers in sequence, returning the result of the second if the first succeeds.

Equivalent to `then(before, parser, second)`<!-- -->.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function preceded<TBefore, T>(before: Parser<TBefore>, parser: Parser<T>): Parser<T>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  before | <code>Parser&lt;TBefore&gt;</code> | First parser to apply, value is discarded |
|  parser | <code>Parser&lt;T&gt;</code> | Second parser to apply, value is kept |

<b>Returns:</b>

`Parser<T>`
